background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，失败可能导致对社会和经济产生重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与麦登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了一个可预测性来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了一个新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并影响了涡旋向下游移动时与纬向流的相互作用。青藏 Plateau（TP）下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是，TP上方在200 hPa处存在强负的位势高度异常，并伴随有气旋异常环流。这种环流响应与TP上方的冷异常相对应，气氛下沉并在上层诱导负的位势高度异常。此外，从TP向北太平洋下游明显显示出波状模式的位势高度差（见图5a）。TP上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡以东则出现强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于170°E，50°N。波状的位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（见图5b）。此外，冷TP表面对位势高度的响应在南半球，尤其是在中纬度地区也有所体现（见图5a，b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，并可以大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系）已被广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，以探索热带气候波动（TRC）波列的详细特征以及大气环流对青藏高原（TP）表面异常的全球响应。众所周知，TP表面的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水中的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng 1991；Lau和Weng 2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang 2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的16个当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探索TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。

findingsCn: LS4P-I结果首次表明，春季的表层温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球波列（TRC）从青藏 Plateau 调制，经过东北亚和白令海峡到达北美西部，同时影响春季的西风急流。这种由青藏 Plateau 热异常调制的 TRC 波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱和洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个遥远地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在生成观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探索它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态被广泛认为在调节地球气候中发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常（如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜）的联系已被用于预测气候事件，具有从几个月到几年不等的有用技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能会影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一个社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是研究观察到的2003年5月青藏高原异常低温是否导致了全球热点地区观察到的6月降水异常。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，通常集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的缺陷。需要进一步研究两个问题：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在澳大利亚西部和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，还是由于其他相关过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESM（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月TP T2m异常和6月降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），使用新的LST/SUBT初始条件进行每个模型的TP，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多个地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，改善5月的地面温度模拟，可以使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，而高山地区的地面温度可能通过升高的加热成为S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常对全球的影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差有关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。
datasetCn: 图1a中显示了青藏高原（TP）地区的T2m异常观测数据，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）气候异常监测系统（CAMS，Fan和van den Dool 2008）的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5，Hersbach等，2020），该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的规则水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位（CRU），在实施分析时使用版本4.02。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，从青藏 Plateau 通过东北亚和白令海峡传递到北美西部，并与春季的西风急流相互作用。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常还可以通过生成跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'LS4P' signify in the context of subseasonal to seasonal prediction research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在次季节到季节预测研究的背景下，“LS4P”代表什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: LS4P stands for 'Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction,' which is a project initiated by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program. It aims to study the impact of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas, such as the Tibetan Plateau, on summertime precipitation predictions at subseasonal to seasonal time scales.
Definition.AnswerCn: LS4P代表“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响”，这是由全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划发起的一个项目。该项目旨在研究高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）地表温度和地下温度异常对夏季降水预测在季节内到季节时间尺度上的影响。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'T2m' in climate modeling and prediction studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 'T2m'在气候建模和预测研究中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: 'T2m' refers to the 2-meter air temperature, which is the temperature of the air at a height of two meters above the ground surface. It is a crucial variable in climate modeling and prediction studies because it is a key indicator of surface temperature conditions. In the context of the studies mentioned, T2m is used to examine the relationship between land surface temperature anomalies, such as those on the Tibetan Plateau, and their impact on global precipitation patterns and predictability at subseasonal to seasonal scales.
Definition.AnswerCn: 'T2m'指的是2米高度的空气温度，即离地面两米高处的空气温度。这是气候建模和预测研究中的一个关键变量，因为它是地表温度条件的重要指标。在提到的研究中，T2m用于考察地表温度异常（例如在青藏高原上的异常）与其对全球降水模式及亚季节到季节尺度的可预测性影响之间的关系。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction in high mountain regions compare to those used for oceanic temperature anomalies?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 高山地区的亚季节到季节预测的数据收集方法与用于海洋温度异常的数据收集方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection methods for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction in high mountain regions focus on land surface and subsurface temperature measurements, such as T2m, and use observations from meteorological stations and reanalysis data. In contrast, oceanic temperature anomalies are often monitored using sea surface temperature (SST) data from satellite observations and buoys. While both methods aim to improve climate predictability, high mountain region data collection emphasizes land-atmosphere interactions, whereas oceanic methods prioritize sea-atmosphere interactions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 高山地区的亚季节到季节预测的数据收集方法侧重于地表和地下温度测量，如2米高度的温度（T2m），并使用气象站的观测数据和再分析数据。相比之下，海洋温度异常通常通过卫星观测和浮标获取的海表温度（SST）数据进行监测。虽然这两种方法都旨在提高气候可预测性，但高山地区的数据收集强调陆地与大气之间的相互作用，而海洋方法则优先考虑海洋与大气之间的相互作用。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences between the challenges faced in initializing land surface temperatures for model prediction and those encountered when using atmospheric reanalysis data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在初始化地表温度以进行模型预测时面临的挑战与使用大气再分析数据时遇到的挑战之间有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The challenges in initializing land surface temperatures for model prediction include preserving memory from LST anomalies and addressing model biases in reproducing observed temperature anomalies. These issues arise due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial conditions. On the other hand, challenges with atmospheric reanalysis data involve ensuring accuracy and consistency in capturing atmospheric conditions, which can affect the initial states used in predictions. Both face issues of model fidelity and data accuracy, but land initialization struggles more with maintaining temporal consistency of anomalies.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 初始化地表温度以进行模型预测的挑战包括保持地表温度异常的记忆和解决模型在再现观测温度异常时的偏差。这些问题源于模型参数化的不足和初始条件的不平衡。另一方面，大气再分析数据面临的挑战涉及确保捕捉大气条件的准确性和一致性，这可能影响用于预测的初始状态。两者都面临模型可信度和数据准确性的问题，但地面初始化在保持异常的时间一致性方面面临更多挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature conditions enhance the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions in remote regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何通过初始化陆地表面和地下温度条件来提高偏远地区次季节到季节降水预测的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) conditions can enhance prediction accuracy by reducing model biases in May temperature over the Tibetan Plateau (TP), which subsequently improves June precipitation predictions. This approach addresses deficiencies in model parameterizations and ensures that the observed temperature anomalies are better reflected in simulations, leading to more accurate predictions in identified global 'hotspot' regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 土地表面和地下温度（LST/SUBT）条件的初始化可以通过减少青藏高原（TP）5月温度的模型偏差来提高预测准确性，从而改善6月降水预测。这种方法解决了模型参数化中的不足，确保观测到的温度异常在模拟中得到了更好的反映，从而在全球“热点”区域实现更准确的预测。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the underlying causes for the errors in simulating Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures in climate models?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 气候模型中模拟青藏高原表面温度错误的潜在原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The underlying causes for errors in simulating Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures in climate models include significant biases in model-produced temperatures, particularly in ensemble means, and deficiencies in model configurations and parameterizations. Additionally, the lack of robust land initialization and the inability of current models to preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies contribute to these errors.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 气候模型中模拟青藏 Plateau 表面温度错误的根本原因包括模型产生的温度，特别是集合均值中的显著偏差，以及模型配置和参数化的缺陷。此外，缺乏稳健的陆地初始化以及当前模型无法保持初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆也导致了这些错误。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential impacts on global atmospheric circulation when using initialized land surface temperatures and snowpack data in Earth System Models for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在地球系统模型中使用初始化的陆地表面温度和雪盖数据进行亚季节到季节预测时，对全球大气环流的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The initialized land surface temperatures and snowpack can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train, influencing early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in regions along the wave train, particularly over northwest North America and the southern Great Plains.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 初始化的地表温度和雪盖可以调节持久的准条形西藏高原-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，影响沿波列的区域，特别是在西北北美和南部大平原的早夏表面空气温度和降水异常。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does improving the accuracy of land surface temperature data influence subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability in high-mountain regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 提高地表温度数据的准确性如何影响高山地区的亚季节到季节降水可预测性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Improving the accuracy of land surface temperature data can enhance subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability, with high-mountain land temperature potentially serving as a substantial source of predictability comparable to ocean surface temperature effects over global 'hotspot' regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 提高地表温度数据的准确性可以增强亚季节到季节的降水可预测性，高山地区的地表温度可能成为一种重要的可预测性来源，其效果可与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度效应相媲美。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the possible outcomes of integrating multiple observational datasets, such as those from the Chinese Meteorological Administration and Climate Research Unit, in modeling atmospheric circulation responses?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合多个观测数据集，例如来自中国气象局和气候研究单位的数据，在建模大气环流响应时可能产生的结果有哪些？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating these datasets can provide a more comprehensive understanding of atmospheric circulation responses, aiding in better prediction of precipitation anomalies and enhancing model performance for subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions by addressing regional biases in temperature and precipitation.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合这些数据集可以更全面地理解大气环流的响应，有助于更好地预测降水异常，并通过解决温度和降水的区域偏差来提高亚季节到季节预测模型的性能。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary objective of utilizing high-mountain land temperature data in subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation predictability studies?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在亚季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性研究中，利用高山土地温度数据的主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary objective is to explore whether high-mountain land temperature, such as that of the Tibetan Plateau, can serve as a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, potentially having an effect as large as ocean surface temperature over global 'hotspot' regions, and to improve prediction models by initializing land temperature.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是探讨高山地区的土地温度，例如青藏 Plateau，是否可以作为季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，潜在地对全球“热点”区域产生与海洋表面温度相当的影响，并通过初始化土地温度来改进预测模型。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to conduct numerical experiments with initialized land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions in climate models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在气候模型中使用初始化的地表温度和地下温度条件进行数值实验很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important to conduct these experiments to evaluate and enhance the performance of climate models in simulating observed temperature and precipitation anomalies, addressing biases, and assessing the impact of land temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation and precipitation prediction.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 进行这些实验是重要的，以评估和增强气候模型在模拟观测到的温度和降水异常方面的表现，解决偏差，并评估陆地温度异常对全球大气环流和降水预测的影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to initialize land surface temperature and snowpack conditions in Earth System Models to improve subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在地球系统模型中初始化陆地表面温度和积雪状况以提高次季节到季节预测准确性的程序是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In the LS4P project, the initialization of land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) is adjusted to address model biases. This is done by modifying the initial conditions based on observed anomalies and model biases. This procedure helps in better simulating the observed anomalies in TP land temperatures and improves prediction skill for downstream precipitation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）的初始化被调整以解决模型偏差。这是通过根据观测到的异常和模型偏差修改初始条件来实现的。这个过程有助于更好地模拟观察到的热带地区土地温度异常，并提高对下游降水的预测能力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can observational data be utilized to identify and enhance prediction skill over global 'hotspot' regions influenced by Tibetan Plateau surface temperature anomalies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何利用观测数据识别和增强受青藏 Plateau 表面温度异常影响的全球“热点”区域的预测技能？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Observed 2-meter air temperature (T2m) records are used to explore the relationship between Tibetan Plateau (TP) T2m and global precipitation patterns. By identifying 'hotspots' where TP land temperature initialization could improve prediction skill, the data helps in enhancing model accuracy for June precipitation forecasts over these regions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测到的2米空气温度（T2m）记录用于探索青藏高原（TP）T2m与全球降水模式之间的关系。通过识别“热点”区域，TP地面温度初始化可以提高预测技能，这些数据有助于提高这些地区6月降水预测的准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with land initialization and model configuration in subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models, and how are they addressed?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 与亚季节到季节预测模型中的土地初始化和模型配置相关的挑战是什么，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The challenges in land initialization and model configuration include preserving the memory of initialized LST anomalies and addressing biases in model parameterizations. These are addressed by conducting experiments that adjust the initial conditions for LST and SUBT, aiming to reduce biases and improve the simulation of observed temperature anomalies in the models.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土地初始化和模型配置中的挑战包括保持初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆以及解决模型参数化中的偏差。这些问题通过进行实验来解决，调整地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）的初始条件，旨在减少偏差并改善模型对观测温度异常的模拟。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methodological advancements or techniques have enabled the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack data for subseasonal-to-seasonal climate prediction models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法论进展或技术使得在亚季节到季节气候预测模型中能够准确初始化地表温度和雪盖数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The implementation of innovative initialization approaches for land surface temperature and subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over high mountain regions, such as the Tibetan Plateau, has been crucial. This involves adjusting the initial conditions based on model biases and observed anomalies to improve the prediction skill of climate models at subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，如青藏高原，实施创新的地表温度和地下温度（LST/SUBT）初始化方法至关重要。这涉及根据模型偏差和观测异常调整初始条件，以提高气候模型在亚季节到季节时间尺度上的预测能力。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might a dataset on Tibetan Plateau land surface temperature anomalies not capture observed anomalies accurately?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么关于青藏高原地表温度异常的数据集可能无法准确捕捉到观察到的异常？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The dataset might not capture observed anomalies accurately due to significant errors in the models producing the observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures, as well as deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该数据集可能无法准确捕捉观察到的异常，因为产生观察到的青藏 Plateau 表面温度的模型存在显著错误，以及模型参数化和再分析数据存在缺陷，这些缺陷导致初始大气/陆地条件不平衡。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges could arise when using high-mountain land temperature data to predict global precipitation patterns?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用高山土地温度数据预测全球降水模式时可能出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges could include robust land initialization and model configuration, which are critical but remain scientifically challenging, as well as the inability of current models to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 挑战可能包括稳健的土地初始化和模型配置，这些都是关键但仍然具有科学挑战性的，以及当前模型无法完全保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆，因为模型参数化存在缺陷。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might an ensemble mean dataset produce precipitation differences in some areas with opposite signs compared to observations?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么一个集合均值数据集在某些地区可能会产生与观测值相反符号的降水差异？
Expectation.AnswerEn: This discrepancy might be due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full Tibetan Plateau surface temperature anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or involvement of other processes not accounted for in the dataset.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 这种差异可能是由于模型在产生完整的青藏 Plateau 表面温度异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的能力不足，和/或涉及数据集中未考虑的其他过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how different data collection methods influence the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions?
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白不同的数据收集方法如何影响亚季节到季节的降水预测的准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictions can be influenced by various data collection methods, such as the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over high mountain areas like the Tibetan Plateau. The precision of initial conditions, observational data quality, and model parameterizations play critical roles in preserving the memory from initialized LST anomalies, which impacts prediction accuracy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 亚季节到季节的降水预测准确性可能受到各种数据收集方法的影响，例如在高山地区如青藏高原的地表温度和地下温度（LST/SUBT）的初始化。初始条件的精确性、观测数据的质量以及模型参数化在保持从初始化的LST异常中提取记忆方面发挥着关键作用，这影响了预测的准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges associated with achieving robust land initialization in high-mountain regions for predictive models.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在高山地区实现稳健的土地初始化以用于预测模型所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Robust land initialization in high-mountain regions for predictive models is challenging due to a lack of observational data and the inability of current Earth System Models (ESMs) to fully preserve the memory of initialized LST anomalies. This is further complicated by deficiencies in model parameterizations and the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric and land conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，强健的土地初始化对于预测模型来说是一个挑战，因为缺乏观测数据，并且当前的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆。这一问题还因模型参数化的缺陷和提供不平衡初始大气和陆地条件的再分析数据而变得更加复杂。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the strengths and weaknesses of using high-mountain land temperature datasets for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation prediction models.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析使用高山土地温度数据集来改善亚季节到季节降水预测模型的优缺点。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: High-mountain land temperature datasets can be a substantial source of subseasonal-to-seasonal precipitation predictability, potentially as impactful as ocean surface temperature datasets. However, challenges arise from deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions that might limit the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies. Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical yet challenging, as current models often struggle to fully capture observed temperature anomalies.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 高山地区的地表温度数据集可以成为亚季节到季节降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其潜在影响力可能与海洋表面温度数据集相当。然而，由于模型参数化的不足和初始大气/陆地条件的不平衡，可能会限制初始化的地表温度异常的记忆能力。稳健的土地初始化和模型配置至关重要，但也面临挑战，因为当前模型往往难以充分捕捉到观测到的温度异常。
